head_text.subj: INT/EXT. EXECUTIVE HELICOPTER, PAPUA NEW GUINEA

text: An out of focus light reflects the deep blue sparkle of t ocean. The scene has a washed out, bright feel, as if fro distant memory. TIGHT on the face of JOSH MCGUIRE (17). He’s gazing throu the copilot window of an AUGUSTA EXECUTIVE HELICOPTER. He’s tall, slightly built and slovenly dressed in skater- gear. He has a wisp of a goatee beard and Optic Nerve sha He looks fidgety, apprehensive. His voice carries the tra of an Australian accent.

I took off. So what? I can do what I want. I’m not a kid anymore. It ain’t all about you. Suddenly, the scene comes sharply into focus, snapping in bright color as the ROAR of the engines grows louder. The DELVENET.COM HELICOPTER banks sharply as it clears th coastline of Papua New Guinea. Lush rainforest as far as the eye can see. In the distanc range of mist-covered mountains. No sign of civilization. edge of the last great wilderness.
They're calling it what? Flying the chopper is self-made billionaire CARL HURLEY (30's). Faded jeans and a t-shirt with ‘MY OTHER HELICOPT IS A JET’ printed across the front.

“Hurley’s Hole”. Josh smirks at this. He turns around to see VICTORIA ALLA (30's) sitting in the rear passenger seat, reading the WA STREET JOURNAL. She looks tired and jet-lagged in her crumpled business suit, but still manages to retain a natural, understated beauty.
Goddamn it!

“Carl Hurley’s latest ‘ego tour’, to dive the ‘Mount Everest’ of underwater caves in Papua New Guinea, has already cost over three million dollars and leaves many shareholders questioning his loyalties...
They can all go to hell.
“The thirty-six year old CEO of Delvenet...”
Jeez, that’s old, man.
Shut it.

“,..whose previous stunts include scaling Everest, diving Brittanic and base jumping the Eiffel Tower, is furious at the lack of media coverage his latest expedition... yada yada yada. There’s a cartoon as well...
Take over. Keep the horizon above the dash, like I told you. Josh flashes a quick look at Victoria, lowering his shade he grabs the CYCLIC STICK. He’s obviously trying to impre her.
No problemo.
Carl!

Give me that piece of crap. Victoria shakes her head wearily and tightens her seat be Carl snatches the newspaper and gazes down at the headlin DELVING INTO DEBT. A caricature of Carl, wearing SCUBA EQUIPMENT as he studies a FINANCIAL FLOW CHART hung outsi cave. Another DIVER informs him “That ain’t your dive profile: it’s your share value”. Josh glances at the cartoon and shares a smile with Victo The chopper wobbles slightly. Josh blushes as he snaps hi attention back to flying.
This expedition’s been a cluster fuck from start to finish. No disrespect, Josh, but your father’s full of shit.
Yeah...
The world’s greatest cave diver. All he can find down there are dead- ends. No wonder we lost press coverage
You're insane. Frustrated astronauts, all of you. Carl gazes down at the rainforest.
There could be miles of unexplored passage down there. Just waiting to be discovered.
Yeah, well. You'd better discover it quick. Here’s your schedule for next week. She hands him a sheet of paper covered in colored bars.
Shit! Carl RIPS up the schedule in frustration.
Shit! shit! shit! A long and uncomfortable silence. Victoria leans forward toward Josh, a smirk on her face.

Looks like ‘Hurley’s Hole’ may remain forever...unprobed. Josh cracks up LAUGHING. VRRRROOM! The helicopter LURCHES VIOLENTLY as Carl grabs CONTROL STICK and flings them 500ft down a steep sided valley. Victoria SCREAMS as Carl expertly puts the helico through a 360’ BARREL-ROLL. Josh clings on for dear life the valley walls flash by. Carl levels off, thirty feet above a huge river, the engi WHINING in protest. Carl is LAUGHING.
You reckless son of a bitch!
That was sweet! Do it again.
VARIOUS SHOTS as the helicopter winds its way down the valley, following the surging river. Victoria tries to en the recalcitrant Josh in conversation.
How’d you wind up here, Josh?
Court makes me see my Dad twice a year.
Bit like boot camp.
What's Frank like? I’ve heard conflicting reports.
Yeah.

“Conflicting” pretty much sums him up. (beat) Alright, folks. We're here... Suddenly, the ground falls away. The helicopter drops ove the edge of a waterfall that cascades 1000ft into a DOLIN vast circular hole in the valley floor. A beautiful rainb hangs above the waterfall. The helicopter powers forward toward BASECAMP: a cluster PORTACABINS and large MACHINERY perched at the far side o the cliff. Josh suddenly looks sad. He stares down at the base of th waterfall, where the river disappears through a gaping vertical crack in the rock.
I can feel your hatred...
At the bottom of the cliff, a thick COMMUNICATION CABLE w its way into the darkness, following the river. BATS and SWALLOWS flit and dart in the dark zone.
..-Taste it... Every hundred feet or so, a HIGH INTENSITY DISCHARGE (HID LIGHT has been clipped to the wall, illuminating the tunn

-.-Breathe it... INT. SANTO CAVE SYSTEM. HIGH SPEED as we follow the cable through miles of cave, slowing occasionally at key points. The cable leads us through tight tunnels, air-filled chambers, surging river and over powerful waterfalls, rigged with rope bridges.
...through miles of rock... Finally, at the end of the tunnel, a dance of light.

The river spills out into a vast chamber, three quarters filled with water. An island rises above the water, illuminated by powerful HID LIGHTS. Forward base looks li an explosion in a dive store: SCUBA EQUIPMENT is littered everywhere: WETSUITS hanging on a line, REBREATHERS and D PROPULSION VEHICLES. In the center of the island sits a large TENT. The glow f several COMPUTER MONITORS can be seen through the fabric. FIBER-OPTIC cable leads from the tent toward a DIVE PLATF that extends into the water.

...I hope you never come out. Australian cave diver FRANK MCGUIRE (early 40's) stands a in the gin-clear water. He wears a scuffed and worn WETSU Frank exudes a quiet confidence. A man who keeps his own counsel. He's as hard and as cold as the caves he explore Frank’s eyes are closed in meditation as he rehearses emergency BAIL-OUT DRILLS. He moves with fluid clarity, a practising Tai-Chi.

Focus on the dive. (beat) High oxygen: close valve, diluent flush, engage manual flight. Good. You ain’t dying down there today. Low oxygen...(beat) Shit! Low oxygen.....- Frank SIGHS and opens his eyes.
That damn kid. Frank takes three deep BREATHS, closes his eyes and start the drills again. VOICES drift over from the far side of cave.
That's the third time you checked that gauge. You sure you're okay?

Yeah. (beat) Just tired. You know... Sitting on the edge of the dive platform is CRAZY GEORGE (40's). George is a tall and wiry Texan who looks like a hippy. busy operating the joystick control of a CAVE MAPPING ROV JUDY 'JUDES' TREBLE (30's) stands in the water beside him She is wearing a CLOSED CIRCUIT REBREATHER and CAVE DIVIN EQUIPMENT. Judes is a serious-minded diver who likes to d things by the book. She also looks great in a wetsuit.
You wanna cancel the dive?
No.
No one'1ll blame you, Judes. He’s had you in the water seven days straight now. When the hell did you last see daylight? Judes looks up at George and forces a smile.
Three weeks ago.
Damn, girl. You’re starting to look like Gollum.
Thanks, George.
Cave's still gonna be here next year...
Try telling Frank that.
You dive for yourself. Not for Frank. “Anyone can call the dive at any time for...”
“,,.any reason.” I know.
So. (beat) Why don’t you sit this one out? Judes deliberates. She looks yearningly toward her SLEEPI BAG at the rear of the cave. She looks tempted when...
You all set? FRANK wades toward them, zipping up his suit. His face is with an intense, determined look. He grabs his REBREATHER from the dive platform and fires up the electronics.
Sure... She looks up at George and squeezes his hand.
Last time, George. Promise. George hands Judes her mask.
I’m gonna hold you to that.
(continuing) Ready as I'll ever be.
George, you in position? On George's LAPTOP, a DIGITAL IMAGE of the cave can be se marked DEVIL'S RESTRICTION. Hundreds of BOULDERS stacked high. A gaping TUNNEL beneath them. Frank studies the scr
Hell, yeah. I still say she's teasin’ us, Frank. Ain't no way through that restriction.
Machines can't feel the cave, George. (TAPS the screen) This one goes. Trust me.

How many times have I heard that? BEEP! BEEP! BEEP! A RED LIGHT flashes above the communica tent. Frank, Judes and George look at one another in conc Crazy George staggers to his feet and hobbles into the te to answer the call. He walks with a pronounced LIMP.
Rain?
No. We're good for a few weeks yet. George pokes his head out of the tent.
It's Carl. Frank’s face registers annoyance.
Hallelujah! “Rich Boy” returns.
He wants a word with you. Frank drags himself out of the water.
I'll bet he does.
Frank slumps down into a chair, surrounded by high tech equipment and several MONITORS. Crazy George hovers in th background. Carl’s face can be seen on the DIVE COM. He doesn’t look happy.
Why are you using the emergency line?
I want a progress report.
You got me out of the water for that?
A bank of high tech electronics, including several MONITO Frank's face fills the screen. Carl SLAMS the table.
Goddamn it, Frank! We’re running out of time...

Alright, I’1l give you a progress report: we’re down here, busting our balls, while you fuck off to pick up your girlfriend. Victoria, Josh and the basecamp manager, JIM SERGEANT (36 hover in the background next to an enormous CAVE MAP. Jim Josh exchange a look: this is typical Frank.
Four months, Frank. I could have dug myself a bigger cave by now.
Yeah, well. This cave don’t follow your schedule. Put my son on the line. Victoria flashes Josh a sympathetic look. Josh SIGHS heav
Carl casts a final murderous glance at Frank before he disappears off screen. George shakes his head wearily.
Nice. Keep on biting the hand that feeds us...
We earned the right to dive here, George. If that softcock wants a piece of this cave, he should try getting his hands dirty. On screen, Josh slouches into the chair and stares sullen
(long beat) What?
You’re on my shitlist, mate.
Whatever.

You were assigned rope man. You’re supposed to be working here as part of the team, not off on some joy ride. 10 Josh stares at his feet and snorts derisively: it’s pret obvious he thinks his old man is a total dick.
Did you hear what I said!?! Josh reaches forward and defiantly flicks a switch. The screen suddenly goes blank. Frank stares in disbelief. Cr George tries hard not to laugh.

Josh storms out, furious and humiliated. Victoria follows a few seconds later. She finds Josh around the back of th office, KICKING the wall. Josh slumps to the floor, head and BREATHING hard. Victoria places her hand on his shoulder. He gazes up at grateful for the attention. His eyes drift across her bod Victoria catches him checking her out. An awkward moment.
Frank storms down to the water, Crazy George limping afte him.
Go easy on him, Frank. The kid deserved a break. Frank wades into the water and starts kitting up.
We’re all tuckered out. That don’t mean he can sneak off whenever he feels like it. Frank SPITS into his mask and winks at Judes.
Ready to rock?
First one to the tunnel “bags the booty”.
In your dreams.
Let's hope this is the one. 11
This is the one. Trust me.
(beat) Then let's do it. They insert their mouthpieces, then grasp hands as a gest of “goodluck”. Venting their WINGS, they sink beneath the surface.

The divers descend toward an UNDERWATER DECOMPRESSION HABITAT, bolted to the walls at a depth of 30 ft. Each diver's REBREATHER has their name boldly stencilled acros the back. CLOSE-UP of Frank’s eyes behind his mask as he moves thro the water. His voice sounds tense and strained.

Focus. Forget the kid. This cave’1l kill you in a heartbeat if you let it. (beat) The cave always wins. The DECO HAB looks like a high-tech lunar landing module. DIVER PROPULSION VEHICLES (DPV's) and STAGE CYLINDERS hav been clipped to a DECO LINE that descends into the inky depths. The DPV's look like miniature torpedoes, fitted w handlebars. The divers collect their DPV's, clip on their STAGE CYLINDERS and power away into the inky depths.

VRRRRR! Powerful HID lights from the DPV's flit across th walls of an enormous underwater cavern. Frank follows a t GUIDELINE that snakes its way across the calcite-covered ceiling. The water is crystal clear: visibility a hundred feet or more. The REBREATHER'S lack of bubbles give the divers the appearance of astronauts, exploring inner spac Frank's voice begins to relax, becoming deep and reverent he recites Coleridge’s famous poem.

In Xanadu did Kubla Khan. A stately pleasure dome decree. Where Alph, the sacred river, ran. Through caverns measureless to man. Down to a sunless sea. 12 They enter a room, where white FLOWSTONE covers the wall It's like a waterfall frozen in time. Stunningly beautifu Frank gazes in wonder as they pass amazing SPELEOTHEMS, connecting the floor to the ceiling. INT. DEEP TUNNEL. Frank and Judes power their DPV's into a long winding tun POV FRANK: the HEADS UP DISPLAY (HUD) clipped onto his REBREATHER MOUTHPIECE bathes his face a ghoulish green gl
70 meters...80...90... BEEP! BEEP! BEEP! A red light flashes across Frank's face his REBREATHER HUD ALARM sounds.
Oxygen spike. Add some helium. PFFT! Frank calmly reaches down and pushes a button on hi COUNTERLUNGS. The HUD turns green again.
No worries. Where’s Judes? VRRRR! Judes overtakes Frank, aiming her DPV toward a nar gap in the tunnel. CRUNCH! Her REBREATHER clumsily scrape against the rock, bringing down a cloud of fine silt.

(continuing) C'mon, Judy-babe. Tighten it up. Frank's eyes narrow in concentration as he follows her in the tunnel. The whirling blades of his DPV PROPELLER slow DISSOLVE INTO... EXT. BASECAMP — DAY THUDDA! THUDDA! THUDDA! The whirling rotor blades of a RUSSIAN KAMOV HELICOPTER as it hovers above basecamp. Operations manager, Jim Sergeant is marching across camp, trying to outpace Carl. Jim used to be a Royal Navy diver Right now, he wishes he was back defusing mines.

Do you think it’s worth me kitting up and going down there? 13 Basecamp is a hive of activity: LOCAL VILLAGERS unloadin OXYGEN CYLINDERS from a huge CRANE at the edge of the dol ENGINEERS inspecting an ELECTRICAL GENERATOR. BLENDING TECHNICIANS operating two large COMPRESSORS.

I doubt it. You want my opinion, Frank’s lost the fucking plot. The KAMOV touches down, creating a huge cloud of dust. Ji approaches one of the local villagers who is supervising unloading of OXYGEN CYLINDERS from the CRANE. Luko (24) speaks in a heavily accented PIDGIN ENGLISH. We catch maybe two words in three. He's a large, powerful ma Respected among his tribe and feared as a fierce warrior. Luko has a BEECH NUT CIGARETTE permanently glued to his bottom lip.

Numato! Tamairi! Yu-two fala ee kam long ples yia mo helpem me- fala. Mix master blong Jesus Christ! Two more VILLAGERS rush over and start loading empty CYLINDERS onto the KAMOV HELICOPTER. Jim removes the cigarette from Luko’s lips and crushes it out, nodding to the FLAMMABLE STICKER on the OXYGEN CYLINDER.
Buy yu sackem-out cigarette blong you, eh? All tank yia ee save boom! Killem all dead. Jim marches over to the basecamp office, Carl doggedly following him.
“Mix master blong Jesus Christ?”
He means the helicopter. Josh suddenly bursts out of the office doorway, with Vict in tow. They are both rigged in CLIMBING HARNESSES. Jim g Josh in a friendly HEADLOCK on the bottom step.
Back in the doghouse, mate! Right where you belong. 14
Surprised he even noticed I’d gone.
Oh, he noticed alright. Took hima full day to get down there without you.
Must’ve been painful to watch.
Yeah, well. Don’t look so chuffed. He’s put you on double rope duty for the rest of the week. Starting now. Josh SIGHS heavily. Victoria places her hand on his shoul
Josh was going to teach me how to rappel...
(long beat) Go on. I haven’t seen you.
Yesss!
(she winks at Carl) You gonna come and hold my hand?
Not now!
Suit yourself. You have two-hundred emails waiting for you in there...
They can all fuck off.
You should go with them, Carl. Try and enjoy the last few days. I’1l let you know if Frank finds anything. Jim disappears inside the office. TIGHT on Carl. He doesn look happy at all. 15
Jim switches on the DIVE COM and gazes at the ROV MONITOR
Where are they, George?
Devil’s restriction.
Crazy George reaches forward and sharpens the digital ima from the ROV. The fuzzy picture shows Frank and Judes arriving at the restriction.
And...let there be light.

WHOOMPH! Several HID lights fire up on the ROV, illuminat the cave as far as the eye can see. Thousands of BOULDERS cover the floor. The boulders have been ground smooth so resemble a pile of gigantic marbles. Judes 'parks' her DPV beneath a natural bridge in the boulders. A gaping black hole leading into the unknown. H DPV PROPELLER stirs up a cloud of SILT.
On the monitor, the image is obscured by silt. Crazy Geor grabs the joystick and powers the ROV upwards.
Bh, shit. Call the scuba police. Amateur alert! INT. DEVIL'S RESTRICTION. The thick cloud of silt engulfs Judes and Frank, reducing visibility to zero.
Deep and slow. Panic kills. Clip on a reel. 16  POV FRANK: we can barely see his hands as he expertly attaches a SAFETY GUIDELINE to a rock in front of him.

Now rise above the situation. PFTTT! Frank adds gas to his WING. LINE rattles off his R INT. FORWARD BASE COMMUNICATIONS TENT. On screen, the ROV hovers patiently above the cloud of si George breathes a SIGH of relief as he watches Frank risi like a ghost, back into clear water. INT. DEVIL'S RESTRICTION. Frank can see Judes light in the cloud beneath him.

She’s gonna be pissed about that. Alright, Frank: focus. Master controller: P-oh-two: fine. Slave: Fine. (PFT! The solenoid fires) There's your second heartbeat. (glances at wrist computer } Depth 98 meters. Run time’s good... Frank's eyes suddenly widen. He notices the silt cloud is being sucked into a hole in the boulders, thirty feet awa
(continuing) Shit! That’s the way through! The cloud of silt continues drifting toward the hole.

(continuing) Oh man, that is strong flow! (gazing around the cave) Got you! Finally! (irritated) C'mon Judes, sort your shit out. Judes sheepishly drifts toward him and flashes an ‘okay' signal. She shakes her head, obviously annoyed with herse 17

(continuing) Yeah, drinks are on you tonight. Frank flashes his light toward the new lead. They swim ov to investigate. INT. FORWARD BASE PLATFORM. Crazy George powers the ROV forward, illuminating Frank a Judes as they follow the silt toward the hole.
Frank, what you doin’, Frank? The DIVE COM crackles.
What the fuck is he up to?
He's smelled somethin’. The ROV focusses on a narrow tunnel winding its way into bowels of the earth. It’s a claustrophobic nightmare.

Oh, Christ, Frank. Leave it. INT. DEVIL'S RESTRICTION. Frank tries squeezing into he tunnel, but the entrance is small. Judes watches apprehensively as Frank removes his REBREATHER. He reaches forward and scribbles a message on her WRIST SLATE. Judes gazes down at Frank’s message: “SHE GOES. TRUST ME! Holding his rebreather in front of him, Frank pushes into tight hole.
Why should I trust you?

I’m the only one around here who can climb for shit. 18 Victoria peers nervously over the edge of the doline. Jo clipping her onto a rope that disappears over the 1000ft drop. Victoria casts a weary look toward Carl. He is pacing alo the edge of the cliff, a SATELLITE PHONE glued to his ear
Carl! Are we doing this or what? Carl lifts his hand, irritated. Victoria rolls her eyes a Josh.
(continuing) I swear they’d still manage to find him on the moon! Carl paces over and thrusts the phone into Victoria's han
Deal with them will you? Tell them I'm uncontactable until further notice. Victoria throws the phone far over the edge of the cliff.
Dealt with. Carl looks suitably shocked.
Sweet!
I'll get my harness. Victoria inches her way to the edge of the precipice and braces herself, ready to rappel down. Carl starts pulling items of CLIMBING EQUIPMENT out of a FLIGHT CASE.
Keep an eye on her, Josh. She’s terrified of heights! Victoria flashes Carl a knowing look. There’s clearly something going on.
No worries. Take it nice and easy, like I showed you. 19
You won’t let me fall? Victoria squeezes his hand. Josh BLUSHES.
Promise. Clear below!
Climb when ready!
Climbing! With a wink and a smile, Victoria suddenly throws herself backwards over the edge. ZZZZIP! Josh gazes in open jawed amazement as Victoria expertly completes the rappel in three bounces.
You can’t beat a woman who's into ropes. Josh looks gobsmacked.
She‘s ex-professional. We met during the Everest expedition.
Wow. That must have been awesome.
Piece of piss after K2. Carl adjusts his climbing harness.
Life's not a dress-rehearsal, Josh. Sometimes you have to seize the day. Carl CLIPS himself onto the rope.

Fifty bucks says I reach the bottom before you. Josh GRINS, inverts himself and leaps off the edge of the cliff. 222ZZZ1P! Josh RUNS down the vertical cliff wall f 600 feet before applying the brake. He glances back up th cliff. Carl is nowhere in sight. 20

Loser! BOING! Josh bounces out into space, spinning in the sunli and emitting a WHOOP of delight. BADOOSH! He swings into glittering WATERFALL. The cascade shatters into a million droplets as the force of the water spins him around and around.
No one can take this away! This is mine! I own it! Josh gazes down at the cave entrance and SHOUTS at the to his lungs.

Inside the claustrophobic tunnel, things are getting tigh Frank’s face is contorted with the physical effort of pus his REBREATHER ahead of him. His breathing rate increases each BREATH sounds deafening inside the enclosed space. Suddenly, he wedges stuck. His HOSES and VALVES scrape against the sharp rock. Frank gazes nervously behind him. INT. FORWARD BASE COMMUNICATIONS TENT. On the screen, Judes is still outside the tunnel, unclipp her STAGE BOTTLES. Crazy Gecrge paces in front of the monitor, clearly agitated.
Plan the dive and dive the plan, D'you recall hearing that somewhere?
Jim has been joined by several EXPEDITION MEMBERS. They c around the monitor, eagerly watching the image.

-.--But, no. Our boy’s gotta go find himself a hole tighter than a nun’s nasty... 21 LAUGHTER from the team. This is the most excitement they had in months. They watch Judes squeezing her way into th tunnel.
100 meters with no bailout. That is hardcore, man.
I’m goin’ after them... The team watch the ROV power forward, BUMPING and GRINDIN it‘s way down the tunnel. BRRRR! BRRRR! A SATELLITE PHONE rings in the background. Jim snatches it up.
Hello? (SIGHS heavily)
Carl stands in the middle of the clearing, adjusting a complicated-looking HARNESS clipped to his chest. The BASECAMP OFFICE DOOR flies open.
Carl! For you. Again. Carl suddenly turns and races toward the edge of the clif
Tell them to...fuck...off! Carl LEAPS into the doline.
Josh is half-way down the cliff face when he hears an almighty SHRIEK from above. He looks up to see Carl falli toward him. Josh instinctively hugs the cliff wall.
Below! cur TO: The EXPEDITION TEAM scatter and drop as Carl falls toward them. Victoria gazes up, open jawed.
oh, Christ!
22 Carl hurtles past Josh in a blur. WHOOMPTH! His BASE JUM PARACHUTE deploys at 200ft.
Yeee-ha! Carl steers the CHUTE expertly down toward the clearing. expedition team gaze up in shocked amazement. Luko has ne seen a parachute before. Victoria's face is a mask of ang
Carl! You reckless son of a bitch!
Frank is still wedged stuck in the narrow tunnel. Flakes rock dance around him. He’s now PANTING in exertion.
Deep and slow. Panic’s a vulture, sat on your shoulder, waiting. There's always slack somewhere, Frank. Try backing up.

Further back in the tunnel, Judes can see Frank backing o toward her. As she tries to turn around, one of her BREAT HOSES gets snagged on a sharp outcrop of rock. Judes WREN it free, bringing down flakes of rock and silt.
Frank starts CHANTING, mantra style as he edges his way forward again.
In Xanadu...did Kubla Khan...A stately pleasure dome...decree... Ahead of him, the tunnel opens up into a gaping black voi
Christ, would you look at that. It's wide open!

Frank pulls himself out of a crack in an underwater cliff re-dons his rebreather. 23 Sudden vertigo as his torch reveals a gaping black abyss sign of the walls or ceiling. Below him, the cave plummet infinity.

Yes! Yes! This is what it’s all about! No-one has ever seen this. No one! Here. Now. This is who you are, Frank Mcguire! A flash of light behind him. Judes pulls herself out of t tunnel, her eyes wide with excitement. She shakes a fragm of rock from her REBREATHER and puts it back on. VRRRRRR! The ROV pops out of the tunnel, filling the cham with light. The cave is monstrous. The ROV’s lights just manage to paint the far walls. Frank and Judes hang in th abyss, like two fireflies inside a cathedral. INT. FORWARD BASE COMMUNICATION TENT. Crazy George can’t drag his eyes away from the screen.
Jim, tell me y’all getting this?
Jim and the team members stare at the monitor in hushed amazement.
Yeah. It’s amazing.(beat) Somebody better fetch Carl. Nobody moves.
That stubborn son of a bitch. He finally did it.
Frank and Judes hover in the abyss, gazing in awestruck wonder at the new cave.

(continuing) Heh! Judy-babe, we have scored big time. This place is... 24  Frank’s eyes suddenly narrow in concern. BUBBLES are streaming from Judes REBREATHER. Frank swims over to her. Frank signals she has a small leak. Judes looks confused. spins around so Frank can take a closer look. Frank notic small tear in the BREATHING HOSE, where it attaches to th COUNTERLUNGS. Frank reaches forward to examine the hose. BADOOSH! The hose suddenly pops free from the REBREATHER. Bubbles EXPLODE as Judes ALARM starts to scream. Red ligh bathes the cave. BEEP! BEEP! BEEP! Judes starts to sink. She signals to Fr still relatively calm: “out of air”. Frank duck-dives down to her. He removes his own mouthpie and offers it. Judes gulps down several BREATHS. They are sinking fast, Judes struggling to locate her WING INFLATO PFFFT! Frank starts pumping air into his WING to arrest t descent. BEEP! BEEP! BEEP! His REBREATHER HUD ALARM flash red as his oxygen spikes. Judes now looks really scared. By now, Frank is desperate to breathe himself. He gently pulls the mouthpiece away from Judes. She's reluctant to it go. Frank pulls harder. BLAM! Judes is suddenly all over Frank in a frenzy, a loo blind panic on her face. She claws at Frank’s face, rippi off his mask. POV Frank: A blurred red nightmare as Judes attacks him. Frank backs away, struggling to restrain her. Her attack grows weaker and weaker until... BLOOMPTH! A final exhalation of bubbles as she finally ta water into her lungs. Frank releases her and pulls out hi back-up mask. POV Frank: his vision clears as he empties the mask of wa Frank watches Judes spiral down into the darkness. Her li eventually disappears. INT. FORWARD BASE COMMUNICATIONS TENT. Crazy George gazes at the screen in horror. Frank turns a looks directly at the ROV CAMERA.
Oh, sweet Jesus, no... 25

EXCITED CHATTER as Carl, Josh, Victoria and Luko travel u the METAL CAGE attached to the CRANE. Carl is showing Jos the BASE JUMP HARNESS. The cage clears the edge of the cl Jim stands waiting for them, looking white as a sheet. Ot expedition members stand in utter shock. Some of them are CRYING. In an instant, all the color drains from Josh's f
He's dead. I wished it. It's my fault. I killed him. Jim steps forward and places his hand on Josh's shoulder.
Your Dad's fine. TIGHT on Josh: unable to disguise his relief. dim casts an angry glance at Carl, who stands holding his BASE JUMP CHUTE.

They just broke this cave for you, Hurley. (beat) Judes didn't make it. TIGHT on Carl as he takes this in. INT. UNDERWATER DECO HABITAT - 8 HOURS LATER. A small bell-shaped structure, large enough to accommodat four divers. Frank dozes on a bunk with a regulator in hi mouth. His REBREATHER is tethered in the MOONPOOL. George reaches over and nudges Frank awake.
Off o2. Frank sits up.
(continuing) How you doin’? Frank GROANS and buries his head in his hands.
104 subtract 7. 26
Christ, George, give me a break...
Start callin’ the numbers.
Ci |
Alright. I reckon you're clear. (long beat) Jesus, Frank. What happened?
Breathing hose. Ripped clean out of her counterlung. She must’ve loosened it going through the tunnel.
Or maybe she was too tired to check it before the dive?
You think I killed her?
Down here, it’s all about knowing when to quit. You taught me that. Frank considers this.
I should go back for her.

The water turns a dirty, blood-red ochre as the divers fo Frank into the 'mixing zone'. Their powerful HID LIGHTS barely penetrate the thick clouds of silt that dance and swirl across their face masks. A surreal descent into a pinkish cloud of ghostly shadows. Frank locates the GUIDELINE and wraps Josh's hand firmly around it. Josh follows Frank’s fins into the murk.

VARIOUS SHOTS as a thick shroud of silt cocoons the diver Frank appears out of the gloom, his thumb and forefinger circled around the GUIDELINE. He sweeps his arm up and do through the murk, like a blind man using a cane. He passe several plastic CAVE ARROWS, clipped to the line at intervals, pointing the way back out. Suddenly, the cave materializes in Frank's HID LIGHT. Josh jumps in fright as Frank’s face suddenly looms out o the dark. They exchange “okay” signals and descend along cave wall. CRUMP! Carl bangs into the cave wall, dislodging a huge STALACTITE. He YELLS a muffled warning into his mouthpiec Crazy George CURSES as the STALACTITE whizzes by, narrowl missing him. Victoria tightens her grip around Crazy Geor wrist. They continue onward. 56

Frank leads the divers along the GUIDELINE until they rea the claustrophobic tunnel. It’s barely visible through th milky white-out. Victoria's eyes widen when she sees how tight the restric is. We hear her BREATHING increase as she fights the risi wave of panic. Frank circles his flashlight: ‘okay?' He receives a shaky signal back from her. Frank and George remove the EQUIPMENT PACKS from their harness and clip them around their ankles, so they can be dragged through the tunnel. Silt swirls. Frank removes his REBREATHER and holds it in front of him The others nervously do the same. Frank signals for Josh ‘buddy up’ with him. Pushing his REBREATHER ahead of him, Frank disappears into the hole. After a few seconds, Josh follows. INT. BODY TUBE - DEVIL'S RESTRICTION. POV Josh: He follows Frank into the tunnel, keeping his h on the line at all times. Frank's pack and fins can just seen scraping along the tunnel ahead. Breathe. Push. Brea Push.
Stay green. Please stay green. Don’t beep. Please. Don't fucking beep.

Back at the entrance, Carl disappears into the tunnel. Cr George turns toward Victoria and taps her on the shoulder She jumps. George shows her a message on his WRIST SLATE: "YOU CAN DO IT", next to a SMILEY FACE. Victoria nods her head, grateful. Crazy George squeezes her hand reassuring Then he disappears into the tunnel. INT. BODY TUBE - DEVIL'S RESTRICTION. A nightmarish sequence as the divers crawl down the body in near-zero visibilty: Frank glances behind him. The dull orange glow of Josh's light approaches. They exchange ‘okay’ signals. 57 Further back in the tunnel, Carl wedges stuck. He tries turn around but can't move. His BREATHING skyrockets. Car braces himself and STRAINS against the ceiling. White fragments of rock break free and dance like snowflakes against his helmet. He eventually manages to pull himself forward. Crazy George freezes as the ceiling starts to CREAK and GROAN. He glances back and sees Victoria waiting patientl for him. They exchange ‘okay’ signals. After a few second George continues, his eyes glued nervously to the ceiling Victoria claws her way forward, following Crazy George's EQUIPMENT BAG. Her eyes are fixed with dogged determinati She’s HUMMING a tune: “ONWARD CHRISTIAN SOLDIERS”, to cal herself down. INT. UNEXPLORED ABYSS. Darkness. Then the hazy glow of approaching lights. A thi cloud of silt billows from the tunnel in the cliff wall. free-fall parachutists emerging from a cloud, the divers break through into the gin-clear waters of the abyss. Victoria finally appears, a victorious grin on her face. Crazy George swims over, shakes her hand and then helps h back into the REBREATHER. Frank shows Josh his VR3 DIVE

Josh nods his understanding. Frank flashes everyone the ‘ signal. VARIOUS SHOTS as the team slowly work their way up the ca walls, decompressing every few feet. Frank swims over to check on the others periodically. The TOTAL DECO TIME slowly ticks down on their DIVE COMPUTERS Crazy George hovers next to Victoria, adjusting her buoya as required. Victoria is SHIVERING from the cold. George her hands, trying to warm her up. Carl swims away from the others, far out into the abyss. busy exploring the far side of the cave. Frank signals for Josh to ascend to the next deco stop. H eyes narrow in concern when he sees Josh isn’t moving. He swims over and catches him playing the 'OCTOPUS' video ga on his VR3 DIVE COMPUTER. Frank MUMBLES angrily into his MOUTHPIECE and signals “up”. 58  Finally, Crazy George flashes his beam to get everyone's attention: the team visibly relax as their lights reflect the surface, far above them.

VARIOUS REACTION SHOTS as the team surface. They remove their MOUTHPIECES and gratefully suck down gr gulps of air. Then they gaze around them in wonder. The cavern is huge: an endless dessert of sand dunes rising f the water and disappearing into the darkness. A sunless Sahara, with no sign of the walls or ceiling. Crazy George throws back his head and emits a WHOOP of delight. His voice ECHOES into the darkness.

Blackness. Josh wakes with a start and stares up at the c ceiling. It takes him a moment to remember where he is. Frank is busy changing the batteries in the FLASHLIGHTS. George is filling a DRIED FOOD PACK with water. Carl is s alone on a rock, staring out into space. Victoria lies SHIVERING inside her SPACE BLANKET: she’s hypothermic and utterly miserable. GEORGE offers her some food. Josh crawls toward the EQUIPMENT BAGS and starts rummagin through the SUPPLIES. He pulls out a food bag and walks d to the water. Frank crouches by the shoreline, his flashl fixed upon a submerged rock far out in the water. He’s watching, listening, feeling the cave.
How are the supplies looking? Josh is still angry. He ignores his father.
I said...
There's food for a couple of days.
This place will be underwater in a couple of days.
How do you know? 59
See that rock? Last night it was above water. Frank marches over to the EQUIPMENT BAG and pulls out sev items: A ROPE, COMPASS and VERTICAL GEAR. Carl shuffles o
How long before they come and get us?
Who?
The rescue party. Frank smiles at this.
There's no rescues down here, mate. Only body recoveries.
But when word gets out I'm missing...
Then what? No amount of money is gonna save you now. Folk up there already think you're dead.
Reckon I should of sold my Delvenet shares. Frank smiles as he shoulders the rope.
I just want to know what the plan is.
No plan ever survived contact with the enemy. And this cave just shat out every plan I had.
Then what, pray tell, do you suggest we do!?! Frank marches over to him. 60
You could try calling your lawyers, so they can sue me. Oh, no. I forgot... Frank lowers his voice to an angry whisper
Some fucker switched the comms off! Carl goes white as a sheet as Frank storms off.
Stay here. I’m going to scout ahead. Carl shouts after him.
I still think we should sit tight and wait a few days!
For what? The lights to go out? Batteries won't last forever. Carl considers this. Then reaches up and switches his HEL LIGHT off.
Fucker. Josh watches his father's light disappear into the distan After a few moments, he decides to follow him.

An expanse of sand dunes stretch along the banks of an underground lake. Frank follows the shoreline, flashing h light around the cave. Josh follows, keeping out of sight Frank pauses to take a compass reading. Josh ducks as Fra light swings toward him. When Josh looks up, Frank is gon Josh considers following. Then gazes nervously around him
Fuck it. He stumbles back the way he came. 61
Back at the sump, Victoria is still SHIVERING uncontrolla A single light casts gloomy shadows across the walls.
How you doing?
I-I still can't feel my feet. Crazy George lifts the space blanket and pulls off Victor soaked WETSUIT BOOTEES.
They're like blocks of ice. Crazy George starts rubbing Victoria's feet and legs. Car casts a glance but decides to say nothing.
T-Thank you, George.
Ain't nothin’.
I mean back there. The way you h-helped me. It was...was... Victoria stops herself before she gets upset.
Pity our illustrious leader doesn't share your humanity.
Frank’s got Josh to think about now.
That man only thinks about himself. He'd leave us all to die if he had to.
Don't go sayin' that. (trying to convince himself) Frank's gonna get us out of here. 62
Christ, George. Wake up. You saw what he did to Luko. What makes you think he values our lives any differently?
He just lives by a different set of rules, that’s all. He did what needed to be done. None of us had the stomach for it.
Precisely. And that's what makes us human beings.
Spare us the morality lessons, Carl. You have no right to judge anyone, least of all Frank. It was a mercy killing.
Yeah? Let's see if the authorities agree when we get out of here.
You can be such an asshole.
I can't believe you're taking his side in this!
He's not the one who got us into this mess!
What's that supposed to mean?
You know damn well.

Josh scrambles BREATHLESSLY to the top of a boulder pile. looks confused and scared when his light fails to reveal others waiting on the other side. Instead, a vast GAPING TUNNEL leads further into the cave. 63
Fuck! (beat) Keep going, you ain’t lost.(beat) They have to be through there... Josh stumbles on, deeper into the cave.
Victoria pulls herself to her feet and staggers towards C
You turned off the comm system. (beat) Didn’t you? Crazy George looks up.
Why the hell would I do that?
“Uncontactable until further notice!” Well, we're pretty un- fucking-contactable now!
You're delusional!
Delusional? Look where we fucking are! You may have just killed us all. A voice from the shadows.
It don't matter now. Frank steps out of the darkness. He's overheard everythin
(continuing) None of it. What matters now is survival.
You're enjoying this aren't you? Making life or death decisions. Playing God. 64
There's no God down here, mate. This cave doesn't give a flying fuck about you, me, or Christ-all- mighty. We're specks of dust to her, passing through.
What the hell was I thinking: letting you talk me into this? You're a fucking animal. Even your son can't stand the sight of you. Frank glances around.
Where is Josh?
Josh reaches the top of another dune. A vast expanse of nothingness lays before him.

Fuck it. Give them a shout, they’re bound to hear you.(beat) You'd never hear the last of it. (beat) Admit it: you're lost. (beat) Alright, retrace your steps... Josh turns and flashes his light back the way he’s come. Three identical-looking tunnels lead into the rockface be him.
Oh, shit.
Frank and George are following Josh's footprints. They en abruptly at the edge of a shingle collapse.
Josh! Josh! His voice ECHOES eerily around the walls of the cave.
Quit freakin’ out. He’ll be fine. 65
Goddamn it, George! You were supposed to watch him!
The boy wanted to go off exploring. (grinning) Remind you of anyone? Frank scowls and storms away. Crazy George smiles as he watches him disappear into the darkness.
Gnnnt George suddenly winces in pain. He lifts his arm and flex it, a concerned look on his face. CuT TO: Josh is about to enter the largest tunnel when...
Josh! He freezes as he hears Frank’s voice. But he can’t tell w direction it’s coming from.
I’m through here! A few seconds of silence.
Don’t move! Keep talking!

What do you want me to say? (beat) I think I’ve found the way forward! (beat) I was just coming to tell you... BLAM! A hand shoots out of the dark and grabs Josh by the shoulder. Frank spins him around and shakes him.
I thought I told you to stay with the group?
You get lost down here and it’s all over. Don't ever wander off again! Understand? Josh bristles in anger and SLAPS Frank’s hand away.

Get off me! Josh's voice ECHOES into the far distance. Frank’s head s up: it sounds like the cave goes on forever. Crazy George steps out of the shadows, still flexing his wrist. He gri through the pain and slaps Josh on the back.
Shoot, I reckon the boy's done found the way forward!

A vast chamber, larger than several football fields. No s of the walls or ceiling. Three specks of light appear in distance. Two more lights trail behind them. Josh plods along next to Crazy George. They both struggle under the weight of their REBREATHERS and also carry a he EQUIPMENT BAG between them. Crazy George keeps flexing hi hand every few seconds, a worried expression on his face.
Asshole. He's a fucking asshole.
Hell, he's just tryin’ to look out for you. Easy enough to get lost in a place like this.
Nothing's ever good enough. I remember writing a school project for him once. A cave diving adventure. He hands it back to me with a list of technical notes...
Yeah. Frank sure likes to give a lotta notes...
I was seven years old, George! 67
Did you hear about the time Frank really fucked up? Josh tries to conceal his interest.

(continuing) Couple of years ago, he’s in the outback, checking out this massive hole, name of... Crazy George grinds to a halt, confused and then a little scared as he struggles to remember the name.
Damn, what was that place called? He drops the EQUIPMENT BAG and leans, exhausted, against large rock. Josh looks at him, bemused.
Anyhow, he backs his truck right up to the water, so he can tie off his line. Then he does his dive. Crazy George takes a long pull of water from his flask.

On the way back out, he sees the entrance is blocked by a vehicle, sixty feet underwater. And he's like: "Shit, that licence plate looks familiar". (beat) He'd only gone and left the handbrake off! Josh smiles.
(continuing) Had to smash open his back window, just so he could swim out! Josh LAUGHS.
And then he has to haul his sorry ass back over 60 miles of desert! (beat) He's a hell of a guy, your old man. Once you get to know him. Josh considers this. 68

(beat) Take the bag will ya? Go on, I'll catch up directly. Crazy George waits until Josh has gone, then starts scribbling numbers onto his WRIST SLATE. His hand is SHAK uncontrollably as he writes: 101-7= Crazy George struggles to do the math. After a few second he realizes he can’t work out the answer.
Ah, shit... He opens the MOUTHPIECE on his REBREATHER and flushes the loop with the button marked OXYGEN. Breathing from the REBREATHER, he staggers after Josh’s light.

location: BOTTOM OF BOULDER PILE, FOOTBALL FIELD CHAMBER

text: Football Field chamber ends in a huge mountain of rubble disappears into the higher reaches of the cave. Victoria collapses, SHIVERING on a rock. She watches Carl’s light ascending up the debris slope, far above her.
Carl! Wait for me! A voice in the darkness startles her. Frank steps out of shadows.
Are you okay?
Hot bath and a brandy and I'd be fine.
We’1l camp here. Frank nods toward Carl’s distant light.
(continuing) I'm guessing this is a little more adventurous than his usual excursions?
Next year we're sticking to Disneyland. 69
How'd you ever wind up with a guy like that?

I ask myself that question every day. (beat) I was one of his guides on Everest. (smiling) Bastard had me fired so I’d come and work for him. How about you? How’d you get involved with the dot-com devil?

Usual sponsors would have turned this into a circus. Twenty guys, all with different agendas. I've dealt with enough of those fucksticks to last a lifetime. Rocks CLATTER down the slope as Carl reaches the top.
I figured your boy up there was the best way to get some real exploration done. (beat) This wasn’t quite what I had in mind. Victoria smiles as she gazes into Frank's eyes.
Well. I’m glad you’re here to look after us.
Don’t go fooling yourself. Down here, you’re on your own. A voice from the darkness above them.

Victoria! You have to see this. It's incredible! Victoria shakes her head sadly and starts climbing the boulder pile. EXT. TOP OF BOULDER PILE. Carl stands on top of the highest boulder. The team stagg up the final few yards to join him. 70

Welcome to 'Carl's Cavern’. Frank and Crazy George exchange a withering look. FLASH! Carl’s powerful CAMERA STROBE reveals the vastness of the chamber they have just walked through. The walls and ceil are covered in millions of delicate white straws.
Hey, Josh! Get up here. We’ll make the cover of ‘National Geographic' yet!

National Lampoon, more like. Josh scrambles up to the highest boulder and poses for Ca Frank storms over and snatches the camera off Carl. He hu it far over the edge of the boulder slope. After a few seconds, we hear it SMASH apart below. A moment of tension as Carl and Frank face each other. Suddenly, Carl launches himself at Frank. George stumbles between them.
Whoa! Let's calm it down!
You fucking asshole! You fuck, fuck, fucking asshole!
Yeah, yeah, yeah.
Why the fuck would you do that? What gives you the fucking right to do that? To me? Frank pushes past George and grabs Carl by the throat, SLAMMING him against the boulder.
You listen to me! When they pull our bodies outta here, they ain't finding no Goddamn tourist shots. Not of me and not of my son, grinning like an idiot! Understand?
Let him go!
Jesus, Frank. You're choking him.
Frank, please. Let him go. Frank releases Carl. Carl slumps to the floor, clutching throat.
They’1l1 find us with our tanks empty and our fingers scraped to the bone. Frank turns to Josh.
(continuing) They ain't handing your mother a Goddamn photograph. Frank storms away, back down the boulder slope.
TIGHT on Frank: looking grim as he fits the last set of BATTERIES into the flashlights. He shoulders his pack and starts KICKING everyone awake.
C’mon. Let’s move. Various GROANS as everyone rolls over in their SPACE BLAN in a vain attempt to go back to sleep.
Now!
VARIOUS SHOTS: Frank leads the team along a series of nar tunnels, winding ever upwards. Several smaller tunnels br off. Frank ignores them and continues moving forward.

The tunnel ends abruptly at the edge of a sheer drop. No forward. The team collapse to the floor, utterly exhauste Frank crouches at the edge of the precipice and launches rock. 72  After six seconds, we hear a distant SPLOSH!
Maybe we missed something? We could always go back...
We ain't going back. Frank tosses the rope down into the drop and secures it.
I want you to start ferrying the others down as quickly as possible...
I-I’'ll try. I’m just not sure I c- can hold a r-ope anymore...
I’1l do it. Give it to me. Frank casts a quick glance at Carl.
No! Josh sags and slouches away. Frank calls after him.

I need a good rope man below. Josh swells slightly at this veiled compliment and starts eagerly prepping his vertical gear. Victoria flashes an approving smile at Frank. Frank shrugs as if to say “yeah yeah”. Carl ambles over to Crazy George, who is resting further the tunnel, breathing oxygen from his REBREATHER. He quic conceals his SHAKING ARM as Carl approaches.
You okay?
Hell, yeah. Just catchin’ my breath.
Why the fuck is ‘Captain Caveman’ taking us deeper? Makes no sense at all. 73
Guess he’s following the river.
All the way to the ocean?
If that’s what it takes. Crazy George goes back onto OXYGEN. Carl calls over to Fr
We've been climbing for six hours now! Surely we must be close to the surface?
I reckon we are about...thirty feet from the surface. Carl gazes up in astonishment. And hope.
But unless you brought some dynamite, that ain’t gonna help us much.
We could at least split up and search those passageways we passed?
They’re too small. We go back down. And hope the lower cave ain’t flooded yet.
I say we vote on it.
You wanna wake up and have a word with yourself. This ain’t no democracy. Frank steps off the edge of the drop and rappels down int the darkness. Josh clips himself onto the rope.
Josh. Help me search those tunnels. Josh deliberates. 74
You don’t have to do everything he says, Josh. You and I can find our own way out of here.
Josh! Get down here! Josh glances down at his father’s light far below. He shr and casts Carl an apologetic look. Josh disappears over t cliff. Carl glowers after him.
Idiots. Carl shoulders his pack.
C'mon. Let’s go. Victoria glares up at him, shivering and miserable. She slowly shakes her head.
I-I’m staying with them, Carl. TIGHT on Carl: an angry and betrayed look upon his face a struggles to deal with this rejection.

Frank stands waist deep in an underground lake, holding o the bottom of the rope. He gazes up at Josh's light far a him. ZIIIIIIP! Josh zooms down the rope and breaks hard, bouncing to a halt only inches above Frank's head. Frank shoots him a disapproving look.
Quit showin’ off. Wait here and help the others. I’1l scout on ahead. Frank shoulders his EQUIPMENT BAG and wades out into the water.
When do I get to scout?
Soon as you stop getting lost. 75

Crazy George is rappeling down a particularly steep part the shaft. His REBREATHER dangles several feet below him, acting like a pendulum. His face is screwed up in pain as edges his way down the sheer cliff wall.
Gnnnng! His body suddenly spasms, his fist clamping up into a tig balled fist.
Oh, Christ. Not now. Please not now... A SHOUT from above causes him to look up. Victoria peers at him, a concerned look on her face.
Are you okay?

I-I'm fine! Momentarily distracted, he doesn't notice his LONG HAIR slipping into the FIVE-BAR RACK. George pushes himself we off the wall. ZIIIP! He plunges several feet down the rop his hand too weak to operate the brake. His hair gets YAN VIOLENTLY into the rack, almost scalping him. In extreme pain, he grits his teeth and remains silent, reluctant to the others know he is in trouble.

That’s just great, George. Call the fucking rope police. He swings himself painfully toward a rocky ledge. Tries t transfer his body weight. Success! A SIGH of relief. Reac toward his DIVE KNIFE, he carefully starts sawing away at trapped hair.
Josh spots something floating on the surface of the water Fishing it out, he realizes it is a clump of HAIR. Curiou he flashes his light up the shaft. 76

Crazy George has almost freed himself from the tangle. As goes to cut the final strand of hair...CRACK! The rock le supporting him suddenly crumbles. SHNICK! His knife SLICES clean through the descent rope. Crazy George starts to fall, his hands scrambling to find purchase, his fingernails SCRAPING the rock until...
(continuing) Unnnng! His fingers wedge into a ledge. He clings precariously to edge of a 300ft drop, his legs and REBREATHER dangling ab the void.
(continuing) Shit shit shit!
Josh gazes up in horror as the rope coils into the water around him.
Victoria feels the rope go slack. She shouts down the dro
off rope?
Crazy George shakes his head at the irony.
No shit, I'm off rope! A SHOUT from below.
Rig another drop line! Now!
77 Victoria leans over the edge and sees Crazy George cling to the ledge far below. The severed rope hangs several fe above his head. No way he can reach it.
Fetch the rope! Quickly! Carl scrambles toward the EQUIPMENT PACK. As he tears thr it, a dreadful realization hits him.
Frank has the rope bag!
Crazy George’s hand SHAKES uncontrollably as he tries to himself back up. It's impossible. He peers down and sees Josh’s light far below him. He closes his eyes in terror mumbles a quiet PRAYER.
Josh yells out into the darkness.
Dad! Dad! No reply. Josh’s eyes narrow in fierce determination. He steels himself, grabs the end of the severed rope and tie to his harness.
Hold on! I'm coming up!
No! Josh! Stay where you are! Josh starts to free-climb the sheer walls of the shaft.

In a last desperate effort, Crazy George swings his legs toward a narrow crevice. Transferring his body weight, he manages to unclip the carabiner supporting his REBREATHER falls away into the darkness below.

Josh navigates his way up a vertical crack in the rock, h feet slipping on the treacherous walls of the shaft. He l precariously toward a handhold just out of his reach... 78 SMACK! The rebreather smashes into him, spinning him off wall. Josh starts to fall. Lightning reflexes as Josh man to grab a narrow ledge. The rebreather SMASHES apart on t rocks below. Josh spots a ledge on the opposite side of t shaft and LEAPS toward it, just managing to cling on.
This is tough enough without you throwing things at me! A voice from below.
Josh! There's a ledge to your left! Josh gazes down at his father's light far below him. Then starts to climb.
Victoria and Carl can see Josh edging his way up the wall toward Crazy George.
He's nearly there! Hold on!
Crazy George's grip is finally about to give way.
I-I can't hold on!
Two more seconds, while I rebelay! Crazy George peers down and sees Josh HAMMERING a BOLT in the smooth cliff wall several feet below him.
I'm slipping!
No! Josh is right beneath you!
Below! Josh lets the hammer fall into the darkness.
79  Frank leaps to one side as the hammer SPLASHES into the water. He gazes up at Josh, flinching with every movement boy makes.
Josh CLIPS his COW'S TAIL into the BOLT, then reaches out toward Crazy George. Crazy George swings tantalizingly ou his reach. Adjusting his footing, he leans out further.
(continuing) I-I've...got you! Josh grabs Crazy George's harness. Just as George’s grip gives way.

Ahhbhh! Crazy George tumbles away into the darkness, taking Josh him. Josh keeps a firm grip on George’s harness and after few feet...TWANG! His COW'S TAIL snaps taut, SLAMMING the both violently against the walls of the shaft.
Gnnn! Crazy George spins inverted, Josh clutching his harness. looks up at him, clearly terrified.
Pass your safety! Crazy George’s hand shakes as he reaches below him and gr his cow's TAIL.

(continuing) Now pull yourself back up! Quickly! Crazy George slowly inches the rope toward Josh's outstretched fingers. Josh finally grabs his carabiner and...CLICK! Snaps him into his own harness. With a GRUNT of relief, Josh releases his grip. They both swing free, hanging suspended in mid air. BREATHLESS and exhausted.
And I thought they called me crazy! 80 Josh threads the severed rope into the bolt and rappels with George dangling below.

Frank is performing a full NEUROLOGICAL EXAM on Crazy Geo who is breathing oxygen from Frank’s REBREATHER. His own REBREATHER lays smashed on the rocks around him. Crazy Ge is having trouble focussing on Frank’s finger as he waves in front of his face. Josh watches from a few feet away, supervising the rope as the others rappel down.
See how his left eye is tracking much slower than the right? Josh nods his head.
Helium bubble. Wedged in his spine. (to George) You’ve bent yourself good and proper this time. Crazy George takes the MOUTHPIECE out and pats the OXYGEN CYLINDER in the REBREATHER.
Ah, quit worrying. Couple more hours of this shit and I'll be right as rain. (beat) Just remind me not to smoke.
Soon as we find some deep water, we’ll recompress you.
(beat) That was a hell of a thing your boy just did, Frank. Frank walks over to Josh and places a hand on his shoulde
Yeah. It was. Josh can’t believe it. A compliment? From Frank? Frank shoulders one of the REBREATHERS and wades out into the darkness. He pauses below the drop and gazes up. 81
Course, I‘d have stuck to the left- hand side of the shaft. Much better hand-holds. Josh and Crazy George exchange a look. Josh rolls his eye
The deafening ROAR of a waterfall can be heard close by. Frank and Josh are busy rigging the easiest route downstr Josh looks back to see Crazy George staggering through th waist-deep water.
What's gonna happen if he can’t walk any more?
I’1l have to kill him. Josh looks shocked. Then realizes Frank is joking. Frank casts an admiring glance back toward Crazy George. Badly injured, yet still helping Victoria navigate the river.
(laughing) We’1ll stick the poor bugger on oxygen at 10 meters. He'll be right as rain. They walk on for a few paces.
You think we could do something safer next year? Like climb the North face of the Eiger?
Yeah, sure. I reckon I owe you that. (beat) No ropes though? Josh walks on. Frank watches him for a few seconds.
I haven’t been the greatest father, Josh. I realize that. Josh stops in his tracks. 82
I guess I just got too hooked into all of this. Josh turns and stares at him.
But it was never really about exploration. This place is my church. Frank gazes reverently around the cave.
My sanctum. The only place I get to hold a mirror to my soul. (beat) I do this because I have to.

Yeah? (beat) Must be real nice for you. Josh walks off. Frank sags visibly as he is overcome with enormous sense of guilt and loss. He reaches out and grab the cold cave walls for support. Then gazes sadly after h son.

The river suddenly disappears over a series of three waterfalls. A steep cliff borders the edge of the falls: easy way down. A thick MIST fills the air. Frank has to S to be heard above the ROAR of water.
Reckon you can find the way down?
Piece of piss! Frank flashes him a disapproving look.
I'll be careful.

We'll rig the zip line! Frank wades back over to the shallows at the edge of the falls and pulls a 50 METER ROPE out of the equipment bag. 83  Victoria sits on a rock a few feet away, SHIVERING uncontrollably. She's helping Crazy George keep his MOUTHPIECE in place. Frank's eyes register concern: Crazy George's condition h worsened considerably. He’s turning blue and his facial muscles now droop like a stroke victim.
(continuing) How you doing, tough guy? George weakly flashes him an "okay" signal.
(continuing) Looks like there’s a deep pool below the falls. Hang in there. Won’t be long now.
On the far side of the river, Josh navigates his way down treacherous rocks lining the falls. It's a torturous desc
Frank and Carl brace themselves against the flow and wade toward a rocky island that sits midstream above the waterfall.
